title: Redis Remote Code Execution
description: A critical remote code execution vulnerability in Redis server that allows authenticated users to execute arbitrary commands on the host system through Lua script injection. The vulnerability exists in the Redis Lua script sandbox escape mechanism, allowing attackers to break out of the script execution environment and execute system commands with the privileges of the Redis process. This can lead to complete system compromise in environments where Redis runs with elevated privileges or has access to sensitive data.

title: Redis Denial of Service
description: A high severity denial of service vulnerability in Redis that can be triggered by sending specially crafted commands to cause memory exhaustion and server crash. The vulnerability affects the Redis memory management system and can be exploited by authenticated users to consume excessive memory resources, leading to service unavailability. This is particularly problematic in shared hosting environments or systems with limited memory resources.

title: Redis Information Disclosure
description: A medium severity information disclosure vulnerability in Redis that allows authenticated users to access sensitive configuration information and potentially extract encryption keys or credentials stored in memory. The vulnerability affects the INFO command implementation and can be exploited to gather intelligence for further attacks.

title: Redis Minor Memory Leak
description: A low severity memory leak vulnerability in Redis that can cause gradual memory consumption over extended periods of operation. While not immediately dangerous, this vulnerability could lead to resource exhaustion in long-running systems without regular restarts.
